intro: Hoya nabawanensis, commonly known as the Nabawan Wanda, is a species of flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves and clusters of star-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, fragrant blossoms that are typically white or pale pink in color. Hoya nabawanensis is an epiphytic plant, often found growing on trees in humid, tropical environments. Its unique appearance and relatively rare occurrence make it a sought-after specimen among plant enthusiasts.
